alert.note: Alert for Estill; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:08PM EST until February 18 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Kentucky... Red River at Clay City affecting Estill and Powell Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River at Clay City. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Major flooding begins. Some residences are inundated with many roads blocked. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Friday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 5.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.1 feet on 02/25/2019. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by Midnight tonight.
